page.title: 16PRISON OFFICER, ARMLEY LEEDS
page.content: I live in Armley and work as a prison officer in a prison built in 1847. There are at present 1300 male prisoners housed three to a cell. It was intended that less than half that number should be here. My duties are to supervise the landings where there are 46 cells, also to do court duties that is escorting prisoners to Crown and Magistrates' Courts. I normally work days but have to do night shifts every 10 weeks. The prisoners have some work to do, mainly tailoring or light engineering. No one has escaped from the cells. The walls are very thick and high. The cells contain a bunk plus a single bed, a table and chairs. They are heated in winter and the walls are painted cream colour. They measure 4m. long by 2m. wide and are 2.5m. high.
